package-manager.name: depot
package-manager.title: Packaging Utilities
package-manager.description: Package-manager independent suite of tools used to install, remove, and configure binary packages. Using an XML configuration file to describe the package, the pkgutils suite automatically downloads and installs packages including all necessary dependencies, provides information on the list of installed packages, removes packages, configures packages (runs the package pre-remove and post-install scripts), and queries a repository for a list of updated packages.

item.para: Security fix for bundled curl:
Apply patch to libcurl to fix possible buffer overflow in data callback buffer.

When downloading data, libcurl hands it over to the application using a callback that is registered by the client software. libcurl will then call that function repeatedly with data until the transfer is complete. The callback is documented to receive a maximum data size of 16K (CURL_MAX_WRITE_SIZE).

Using the affected libcurl version to download compressed content over HTTP, an application can ask libcurl to automatically uncompress data. When doing so, libcurl can wrongly send data up to 64K in size to the callback which thus is much larger than the documented maximum size. An application that blindly trusts libcurl's max limit for a fixed buffer size or similar is then a possible target for a buffer overflow vulnerability.
Security fix for openssl curl:

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3555 (http://www .cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3555). The TLS protocol, and the SSL protocol 3.0 and possibly earlier, does not properly associate renegotiation handshakes with an existing connection, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to insert data into HTTPS sessions, and possibly other types of sessions protected by TLS or SSL, by sending an unauthenticated request that is processed retroactively by a server in a post-renegotiation context, related to a "plaintext injection" attack, aka the "Project Mogul" issue.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-4355 (http://www .cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-4355). Memory leak in the zlib_stateful_finish function in crypto/comp/c_zlib.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via vectors that trigger incorrect calls to the CRYPTO_cleanup_all_ex_data function, as demonstrated by use of SSLv3 and PHP with the Apache HTTP Server, a related issue to CVE-2008-1678.
Recompile bundled openssl without -fast on Solaris/x86 to avoid 3DNow extension
